c74object.name: bach.lcm
c74object.description: Computes the least common multiple of two numbers or of an llll.

inlet.digest: The first number or the llll of numbers

outlet.digest: 1 The least common multiple of the numbers

objarg.name: second-number
objarg.description: You can set the second number (the one input in the second inlet) also as argument.

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the least common multiple of the most recently received input data.

method.name: int
method.description: A number in the first inlet sets the first number and outputs the least common multiple of this number with the one input from the second inlet (or set as argument). A number in the second inlet sets the second number for calculation.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set llll of numbers and output result
method.description: An llll in the first inlet sets all the numbers whose joint least common multiple must be computed, and outputs such least common multiple. The llll is expected to be an llll only containing integers.

c74object.discussion: The implemented relies on the gcd Euclidean algorithm.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (int/llll)
entry.description: The first number or the llll of numbers.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (int)
entry.description: 1 The least common multiple of the numbers.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The implemented relies on the gcd Euclidean algorithm.
